questions.question: Which molecule shown has a carbonyl functional group in the form of an aldehyde?
In the cis configuration, the methyl groups are placed ____.
possible_answers: to the left of the double bond
on opposite sides of the double bond
on the same side of the double bond
questions.correct_answer: on the same side of the double bond

questions.question: Which molecule shown contains a carboxyl group?
Which molecule shown above can contribute negative charge when positioned in a chain?
Why are hydrocarbons insoluble in water?
possible_answers: The majority of their bonds are nonpolar covalent carbon-to-hydrogen linkages.
They are less dense than water.
The majority of their bonds are polar covalent carbon-to-hydrogen linkages.
They exhibit considerable molecular complexity and diversity.
questions.correct_answer: The majority of their bonds are nonpolar covalent carbon-to-hydrogen linkages.

questions.question: The element present in all organic molecules is ________.
Choose the term that correctly describes the relationship between these two sugar molecules.
Which of the following statements correctly describes cis-trans isomers?
possible_answers: They have the same chemical properties.
They have an asymmetric carbon that makes them mirror images.
They have variations in arrangement around a double bond.
questions.correct_answer: They have variations in arrangement around a double bond.

questions.question: Which molecule shown above contains a functional group that is a part of the molecule known as the "energy currency of living organisms"?
The two molecules shown in the figure are best described as ________.
Thalidomide and L-dopa are examples of pharmaceutical drugs that occur as enantiomers, or molecules that ________.
possible_answers: are mirror images of one another
are mirror images of one another and have the same biological activity
questions.correct_answer: are mirror images of one another

questions.question: Organic chemistry is currently defined as ____.
possible_answers: the study of compounds made only by living cells
the study of natural (as opposed to synthetic) compounds

questions.question: Research indicates that ibuprofen is a mixture of two enantiomers; that is, molecules that ________.
possible_answers: differ in the arrangement of atoms around their double bonds
are mirror images of each other
have identical chemical formulas but differ in the branching of their carbon skeletons
differ in the location of their double bonds
questions.correct_answer: are mirror images of each other

questions.question: Which of the functional groups shown is present in ethanol but not in ethane?
Which of the groups is an acidic functional group that can dissociate and release H+ into a solution?
Which chemical group is most likely to be responsible for an organic molecule behaving as a base?
The figure shows the structures of glucose and fructose. These two molecules differ in the ________.
possible_answers: number of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms
number of oxygen atoms joined to carbon atoms by double covalent bonds
arrangement of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms
types of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms
questions.correct_answer: arrangement of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms

questions.question: The complexity and variety of organic molecules is due to ________.
possible_answers: the chemical versatility of carbon atoms
the diverse bonding patterns of nitrogen
the variety of rare elements in organic molecules
questions.correct_answer: the chemical versatility of carbon atoms

questions.question: Which molecule shown is a thiol?
The two molecules shown in the figures are best described as ________.
Which molecule has at least one carbon atom attached to three different chemical groups?
The figure shows the structures of glucose and fructose. These two molecules are ________.
What is the name of the functional group shown in the figure?
